triples.name: Temporal Logic
triples.relevance: Paper uses temporal logic specifications for defining control synthesis objectives in multi-robot systems.

triples.name: Optimal Control
triples.relevance: Optimal control theory provides the foundational framework for the paper's control synthesis approach.

triples.name: Büchi Automaton
triples.relevance: Paper uses transitions and accepting states in Büchi automata to guide the sampling process toward goal states.

triples.name: Motion Planning
triples.relevance: Paper proposes STyLuS*, a novel algorithm for synthesizing optimal motion plans under temporal logic constraints.

triples.name: Graph Traversal
triples.relevance: Existing approaches use graph search techniques that the paper extends with sampling-based methods.

triples.name: Linear Temporal Logic
triples.relevance: Paper explicitly synthesizes plans from linear temporal logic specifications mentioned in the abstract.

triples.name: State-Space Representation
triples.relevance: Paper incrementally approximates the state space and transitions of the synchronous product automaton.

triples.name: Monte Carlo Method
triples.relevance: Sampling-based algorithms used in the paper are probabilistic techniques related to Monte Carlo methods.
